parameterdescription.para: Matrix where the cell lookup happens.

briefdescription.para: Analyzes the number of alive neighboring cells to the specified cell.

simplesect.para: The number of alive neighboring cells to the specified cell.

briefdescription.para: Copies a matrix recieved as a parameter to the target matrix.

Reads a map of size specified previously. It can be entered either by hand or by piping a .txt file. Input must end with the character 'f'. It is not necessary to have a separator between values. If the length of a column is exceeded, it will be included in the next one.

parameterdescription.para: A matrix to store the world map in.
Where the generated world is saved

briefdescription.para: Handles world initialization. Allows the user to select different input methods to customize the world to load. Includes instructions on how to manually load a world file.

parameterdescription.para: matrix where the initial world state is saved.

briefdescription.para: Advances the current generation, analyzing the future state of all cells.

parameterdescription.para: world matrix where the current state is and the future state will be saved before returning.

simplesect.para:
This function implements John Conway's Game of Life rules
A living cell with exactly two or three living neighbors stays alive
A dead cell with exactly three living neighbors becomes alive

briefdescription.para: Reads an unsigned number from stdin.

simplesect.para: 1 if the first char is '\n', -1 if it's 'q', the input number if it's valid, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Prints the world state to stdout in a polished format.
